description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vn64","text":"This protocol describes an automatizable pipeline for cell counting based on fluorescent stainings with the help of CellPose. Additionally, it describes the entire generation process of plots that show the intensity of neuromelanin per cell based on bright-field images. The protocol includes Fiji macro codes for data analysis and an R code for plot generation. This pipeline has been used for the analysis of locus coeruleus data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: cell pose, cell segmentation. neuromelanine, qunatification
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"1regm","text":"Bright-field images of neuromelanin positive regions, and fluorescent staining images of TH (tyrosine hydroxylase)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsekk","text":"CellPose (2.2.3)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bo93l","text":"ImageJ/Fiji (1.54f)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9721u","text":"Excel or LibreOffice Calc","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vgo9","text":"RStudio (2023.09.1) and R (4.2.1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"7peg9","text":"Stringer, C., Wang, T., Michaelos, M., \u0026 Pachitariu, M. (2021). Cellpose: a generalist algorithm for cellular segmentation. Nature methods, 18(1), 100-106.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":124,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":140,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"15aad","text":"Start with images of 35μm thick slices of one z-plane and merged channels. In case of several z-planes, create a Maximum Intensity or a Sum Slices projection in ImageJ/Fiji. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":161,"length":11}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4000E305A95643CC8D52F1DCD8CA3605","url":"http://wsr.imagej.net/distros/win/ij152-win-java8.zip"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a4o96","text":"Crop the area that you would like to analyze.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ql70","text":"Separate the channels and save each channel with an informative title in TIFF format (eg. channel_mouse-id_slice-info_side.tif). It is useful to use the same type of separator between each piece of information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":101}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4sktv","text":"Install CellPose following these steps: https://pypi.org/project/cellpose/. You can use Nvidia GPUs to make the software more efficient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":34}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"47B1EC1CBF8F11EEBDBC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://pypi.org/project/cellpose"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7l9nu","text":"Open CellPose and drag a fluorescent image over the gui to open it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3lbh","text":"Estimate your average cell size; you can do it with the help of Fiji.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u8ok","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0064","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dqrnu","text":" Press enter. On the bottom left of the picture you will see a pink circle which has the diameter that you have specified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA639BC0D1724C85B2AC82CEEB8182BE","height":"128","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"c8mt9\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/qYPee6dIAWayL7pCTqJsuXCdKk2jk1wDfPLWTep_1kiIpCUv8fvAUlcfF4YI8iChzo3yzfr6VArziFNb7-p40zNn-iLWnxV8jr2By3eCg2htM3ferTPkcaivpAfvuC41Q3hOiSQ0JR1aITEp0DxWep4","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/qYPee6dIAWayL7pCTqJsuXCdKk2jk1wDfPLWTep_1kiIpCUv8fvAUlcfF4YI8iChzo3yzfr6VArziFNb7-p40zNn-iLWnxV8jr2By3eCg2htM3ferTPkcaivpAfvuC41Q3hOiSQ0JR1aITEp0DxWep4","width":"275"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dq1l5","text":"Choose which channel to segment. (Gray works for any image with only one channel.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dsfnq","text":"Find a reliable model.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rie5","text":"Try pretrained models. You can do it by clicking on any of these. The compute style and run suggested model will suggest a model for you. Try cyto2 - this is probably the most robust model so far.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mgv3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pgjt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8e39i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ao2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CC6F23C3CD64421BA62B82B2463B759","height":"121","is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/qLx5cZt9M_2fdgQbALKhCAbmnQD28Chzp7bK0E_nuduOp-qdRuQ_swsdFP9Jcjm5FVqUvafE5blY5-Pzg64kclDfkcS20PrPw30OO4a9iRK05WjXaI8gERI-GFLXDutLnhGrllsDEJ43tZB6mh9E7fo","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/qLx5cZt9M_2fdgQbALKhCAbmnQD28Chzp7bK0E_nuduOp-qdRuQ_swsdFP9Jcjm5FVqUvafE5blY5-Pzg64kclDfkcS20PrPw30OO4a9iRK05WjXaI8gERI-GFLXDutLnhGrllsDEJ43tZB6mh9E7fo","width":"270"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cagc0","text":"If the pretrained models do not give a reliable segmentation, choose the pretrained model that works the best and train it to become better. You can remove unnecessary masks by holding Ctrl and clicking on the mask. If you want to draw more masks, go to the edge of a cell, right click, and then you can draw the outline of the cell. The resulting image+masks will be automatically saved in the folder of the image in an *.npy format.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an06n","text":"Segment your images. That is: drag each image to the gui, run the model that you chose, take note of the number of identified ROIs and save your masks. Save them in one folder in PNG format for further analysis. It is possible to automate this step in ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co98m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ffs8k","text":", but only with pretrained models.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"software","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"developer":"","guid":"49F8CACC341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","link":"https://cellprofiler.org/","name":"Cell Profiler","os_name":"","os_version":"","repository":"","version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18plt","text":"Create your training dataset. You should have at least 20 reliable *.npy files saved in the same folder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"867t8","text":"Train a model (Ctrl+T). You have to choose the initial (pretrained) model, you can specify the learning rate, the weight decay and the number of epochs. ~500 epochs can give a reliable, but not overfitted model. Give a name to your network. On the right, you can see all the *.npy files in your folder which will be used as the training dataset.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"627fg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hirm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2eukt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DF0F172CD7254C628D4B063252C8050F","height":"319","is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/bZrGKR4CNcDozgvSfz_6Lq20Iilas44jECoaiUhVs0c5VZXmsDJ-rQD10PiPgqGfop5RlehLfaGRqEz9G1_j5yzD_A5cDCohvraFo_L0gdD0izGYeWxZbVoS0oDH1iplqFQdrKnJ553uqJr09VY3aBQ","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh7-us.googleusercontent.com/bZrGKR4CNcDozgvSfz_6Lq20Iilas44jECoaiUhVs0c5VZXmsDJ-rQD10PiPgqGfop5RlehLfaGRqEz9G1_j5yzD_A5cDCohvraFo_L0gdD0izGYeWxZbVoS0oDH1iplqFQdrKnJ553uqJr09VY3aBQ","width":"564"}}}}

steps.section: Neuromelanin quantification per cell (based on TH staining and bright-field)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jo8t","text":"Save your bright-field images and the CellPose masks based on the TH staining images in two separate folders. Make sure that the two folders contain the same amount of images, and the images are in the correct order (so that the first bright-field image corresponds to the first CellPose mask, the 2nd to the 2nd and so on).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Neuromelanin quantification per cell (based on TH staining and bright-field)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"588ii","text":"Open ImageJ/Fiji. Go to Analyze \u003e Set measurements, and untick every option, except for Mean gray value.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Neuromelanin quantification per cell (based on TH staining and bright-field)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f1d3d","text":" Then go to Plugins \u003e New \u003e Macro and copy the following macro:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gkct","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9eq5v","text":"This macro loops over the two folders and saves the mean gray value of each TH+ ROI identified by CellPose on each bright-field image. Each line corresponds to one image, and each cell is an ROI. The values are distributed between 0 and 255, where 255 is white, and 0 is black.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ee8e","text":"If you use Excel to open the *.csv file, you might have to set the separator to be a semicolon.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1cgg5","text":"function steps.section: Neuromelanin quantification per cell (based on TH staining and bright-field)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"41acg","text":"Add a few columns to the beginning of the csv. Copy and paste all your image paths from one folder (select all files in your file manager, and copy path) and convert these paths into useful columns. Ctrl+H helps to delete unnecessary information (eg. folder info). In Excel or in LibreOffice, go to Data and Text to columns, and choose the separator which you use in your file names. Name your columns. If it is necessary, add a column which contains information about the experimental group.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Neuromelanin quantification per cell (based on TH staining and bright-field)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3k63p","text":"In ImageJ/Fiji, Go to Analyze \u003e Set measurements, and untick every option, except for Modal gray value.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"59uat","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8uk3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d2ohs","text":"Open RStudio, create a new R notebook and copy the following code to visualize the distribution of the ROI intensities. However, you can adjust this code to your needs, for example, if you do not have a 'time' variable, you can remove it from the
